pages.text:
Join Our Team
Come make a positive difference in the lives of the youth, adults, and families in our community while developing the values of caring, honesty, respect and responsibility.
Employment
Front Desk/Volunteer Coordinator
The Center of Anna Maria Island is hiring Front Desk Staff. The Front Desk staff must demonstrate a personal understanding and appreciation of The Center’s mission and purpose. This position is part time position offered up to 20 hours per week. The schedule will vary by season/events. The position requires excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills. The person must demonstrate an ability to work effectively with people and be a team member. The person also must work effectively on their own. This position requires good organizational skills, strong human relation skills, general knowledge of business procedures, good communication skills, and willingness to adapt to change. This position will help execute the daily functions of the front desk and also coordinate our volunteer program. This person must have a working knowledge of operating computers, be able to work in a fast pace environment, be flexible, provide a professional and friendly service to all customers, be able to handle and help resolve member concerns, and be able to multi-task. Must be proficient in word, excel, and have a general knowledge of software systems overalls. Must be able to work flexible schedule.
Send resumes to
Tyler@centerami.org
.
Internships
The Center of AMI offers Internships in the following departments:
Recreation & Sports Management
Nonprofit Program Administration
Sports Marketing & Public Relations
Early Childhood Education
Exercise Science/ Fitness
Senior Programming
Social Work
Internship will include but is not limited to the following experiences:
Attending trainings addressing program disciplines.
Planning, implementing, facilitating, and evaluating programming.
Assisting staff with programming and administration.
Planning, assisting, overseeing and chaperoning group and community programming.
Driving the Center vehicles.
Maintaining and gaining experience with various technology, to include management of donor software and volunteer management software.
Creating and complete an intern project to be determined from your interests and the needs of the Center.
Assisting with both administrative duties, as well as facility/fields management duties as needed.
Gaining experience with the administrative aspects of fundraising.
Coordinating special events and fundraisers
Executing the Center Communications Plan to include Social Media Platform management, as needed and when appropriate. Website maintenance as well.
Complete college/university assignments as needed
Maintain Center Staff and University Internship professional protocols and expectations
Internship Description & Application
Volunteer
The Center of Anna Maria is looking for individuals interested in helping at “the community’s gathering place”. We are are looking for people to help with coaching, tutoring, events, and welcoming guests at the front desk and more.
Why volunteer at The Center?
1. It’s fun!
2. You can help make an impact on the lives of children, seniors, and your community.
3. There is something for everyone (be a coach, tutor, mentor, help at events and more)
4. Be a part of an amazing team and make new friends!
5. Learn something new or teach someone else something new!
Interested in sharing your talent and helping out others?
For more information about volunteering please contact Morgan Blackburn at
hello@centerami.org
or call
(941) 778-1908.
If interested in volunteering please
click here
to fill out a volunteer form
Click here
to fill out a Volunteer form online or
Click Here
to print a PDF.

Staff

Events
The Center of Anna Maria Island hosts a wide range of events throughout the year that bring our community together in fun and meaningful ways. Music lovers won’t want to miss the Bradenton Gulf Island Concert Series, which has featured legendary acts like the Marshall Tucker Band, The Grass Roots, The Wailers, and more. Each fall, we kick off the season with a spirited Bowling Tournament that’s always a hit with locals and visitors alike. A holiday favorite for families, Lester Family Fun Day offers festive cheer with visits from Santa, seasonal crafts, games, and live performances for all ages.
For those who enjoy a little mystery and laughter, our annual Murder Mystery play is a must-see event tailored for our adult audience. In the cooler months of winter and spring, we keep the energy high with Bingo nights—always a fun way to spend an evening. Throughout the year, we also host Family Fun Nights, offering families a chance to unwind, connect, and enjoy playful activities together at The Center.
Be sure to check back regularly for details on upcoming events, dates, and how to get involved. There’s always something exciting happening at The Center!
Click here for information on concerts
The Greg LaPensee Bowling Tournament
Join us for a night of friendly competition, prizes, and community fun at this year’s annual bowling tournament.
Date:
Saturday, September 6, 2025
Time:
Check-in begins at
5:30 PM
Bowling from
6:00 PM – 8:00 PM
Awards & Raffle to follow
Location:
Bowlero Bradenton
4208 Cortez Rd.
Lanes are limited—secure yours before they’re gone!
Sponsorship & Lane Pricing:
To reserve your lane,
click here
or call The Center at
(941)778-1908

Includes:
6 players
Custom metal koozie and Center fishing shirt for each player
Shirts printed with your business logo
Business logo displayed at your lane and at check-in
To be included on the shirt, register and send your logo by August 21st.
Lane Sponsor with Players – $500
6 players
Business logo displayed at your lane and at check-in
Lane Sponsor without Players – $275
Business logo displayed at your lane and at check-in
Standard Lane – $350
6 players
Reserve your spot today—lanes fill quickly and space is limited!

Lester Family Fun Day
Save the date: Saturday, December 6th!
Old fashioned fun at old-fashioned prices”. The 23rd Annual Lester Family Fun day, generously sponsored each year by Chuck and Joey Lester of Holmes Beach, returns again this year with a lineup of fun activities and performances. There will be food and fun with a visit from Santa!

Rock ‘N’ Support Grant
Are you a hospitality or tourism worker in the Manatee County Gulf Islands Community who faced financial hardship due to Hurricane Helene or Hurricane Milton? You may qualify to apply for the Rock ‘N’ Support Grant.

About
What is The Center of Anna Maria Island?
The Center is a non-profit community center on Anna Maria Island. The Center strives for excellence in meeting the human service needs of all those living on or nearby our barrier island. We are focused on the community and open to all.  In doing so, the Center is often seen as an “Educational Center,” a “Recreational Center,” a “Youth/Teen Center,” a “Fitness Center,” and a “Senior Citizen Center,” and also serves as a
The Center Post Disaster Shelter
. The  Center is all of these and much more.
Who do we serve?
We serve children, teens, fam
ilies, adults, and senior citizens. Here our senior citizens gather for cultural, educational, health and social pro
grams. Children and teens participate in character building before and after school and are involved in athletic endeavors, art, drama, music, camps designed to develop their best potential.
Families and individuals participate in classes ranging from yoga to meditation to karate. Islanders look to the Community Center for all this, as well as family support and counseling, individual achievement and the true meaning of a caring community.
The Center offers numerous cultural, recreational, and educational programs for all ages, including socials, lectures and workshops. The Center has a fitness center, tennis courts, pickleball courts and sports fields. We have many exciting events planned in the coming months that you’ll want to participate in.
There is plenty to do for the entire family! We have before and after school care for children as well as summer camps for ages 5-14. We offer teens a fun place to hang out filled with the things that they like to do and learn. You may enjoy a wide variety of adult classes such as Meditation, Pilates, Yoga,  Cycling, Tai Chi,  Lunch and Learns, and much more. Perhaps you want to get in shape with our varied recreational sports programs for both adults and children.
There is so much to see and do. Please take a look at all we offer and feel free to call or visit for more details on fees and schedules.
Click here
to learn more about becoming a member. We hope to see you soon!
When is The Center Open?
Center’s Hours
Monday 7am-8pm
Tuesday 7am-8pm
Wednesday 7am-8pm
Thursday 7am-8pm
Friday 7am-7pm
Saturday 8am-3pm
Sunday Closed
The Center will be closed on the following days:
November 25th, 26th, & 27th
December 24th & 25th
December 31st & January 1st
Memorial Day
Independence Day
Labor Day
A week in August for staff training and maintenance
The Center’s weather policy is that if Manatee County Schools are closed then The Center is closed.
The Center also serves as a post Hurricane Shelter:
The Center Post Disaster Shelter
Class/program schedules, fees, instructors, policies and procedures are subject to change.
The Center’s EIN is 59-6166231

Memberships
Being a member of The Center of Anna Maria awards you with an amazing opportunity to connect with people from all over the world who have found their “home” here on AMI. Whether you are
a young family with children at Anna Maria Elementary or are a snowbird participating in pickleball- the community serves to bring everyone together and is the true “center” of this beautiful paradise island!
Enjoy the following benefits included in your Center membership:
New Showers
Peloton Bikes
Crossfit Training Equipment
Newly Renovated Facilities
New Cycling Equipment
Unlimited Group Fitness and Wellness Classes
$20 League Sports
Access to Fitness Center
Tennis Courts
Pickleball
Discounts on Specialty Fitness Classes, Sports and Camps*
Discounts on Summer Camp*
Discounts on After School Care*
Open Gym and Field Time
Playground
And More!

Family Pricing:

**
Fitness Center:
Children under the age of 10 are not allowed in the Fitness Center. Children 10-15 may be in the Fitness area as long as they are exercising under direct adult supervision. Those 16 and up may use Fitness Center if they are Center members or have a Center Pass.

Support
A donation to The Center  helps ensure The Center can continue to maintain our community wellness programs. Help sustain our ability to lead in providing the highest level of programs, events, and instructors at an extremely competitive price.
If you have questions or want more information please contact our Director of Development, Jillian Ptak at
development@centerami.org
or
(941)778-1908
ext.201
Thank you for Foundation and Grant Support!

Board Members
Don Purvis
Board Chair
Don is a native of New Orleans, Louisiana and he moved to Anna Maria Island in 2010 with his wife, Leah. He holds a Bachelor's Degree in Political Science from Rhodes College in Memphis, Tennessee and a Master's Degree in Education Leadership from Union University. Don played professional football in Europe for two seasons following his graduation, and he was a high school teacher and football coach for eleven years before moving to the real estate profession in 2012. Don has been active in Fellowship of Christian Athletes and St. Jude Children's Hospital throughout his career, and he served on the area board of Coaches of Excellence. Currently Don is the managing broker and an owner of Beach House Real Estate in Holmes Beach.  He and his wife regularly participate in adult sports, CrossFit and the annual Murder Mystery Play at the Center.
Daniel Anderson
Board Treasurer
Daniel Anderson is a CPA and Partner with Mauldin & Jenkins, specializing in Assurance Services for State and Local Governments, as well as non-profit organizations. He grew up in Bradenton, Florida, and attended the Florida State University, where he received his degree in Accounting.
He currently resides in Bradenton with his wife, Gina, and two Children, Nolan and Sutton. In addition to serving on the Board at the Center, Daniel serves on the FICPA State & Local Government Committee and is a member of Bradenton Kiwanis. He has previously served on the Boards of the Manatee Seminole Club, as well as the Leadership Manatee Alumni Association. Daniel was a member of the 2017-2018 Leadership Manatee Program, as well as the 2017 FICPA emerging leaders program. In his spare time, he enjoys spending time outdoors enjoying the beaches and waterways of Manatee County with his family, coaching his children’s you sports team, and watching all FSU sports.
Remi Drigan
After receiving a Masters degree from Johns Hopkins University and a Bachelor of Science degree from the University of Richmond, Remi pursued a successful career in healthcare technology sales. Her business career spans 35 years with over 20 in high end corporate sales, selling software, consulting and integrated outsourcing services.
Since moving to Anna Maria in 2005 Remi has been actively involved with The Center, volunteering, attending classes, working out, and supporting fund raising activities. She believes in the power of philanthropy, is a founding member of the Anna Maria Women’s Giving Circle and is currently an active member of The Garden Club, The Anna Maria Historical Society and Impact100 SRQ.
Sheila Fusé
Sheila and her husband, Joe, moved to Anna Maria Island in 2013. Sheila holds a Bachelor's Degree in Information Systems and Business from UMASS Lowell. She spent the first half of her career in banking working at Chase, JP Morgan and RBS and left banking for healthcare in 2012 when the Affordable Healthcare Act (ACA) was released, and value-based care was introduced. Sheila founded Primary Partners and launched one of the country’s first independent physician Accountable Care Organization (ACO) and moved to Florida. Sheila spent the last half of her career in healthcare and value-based care working with hospitals, health plans and physician groups. Currently Sheila is Founder and CEO of a Redesign Health Stealth Company focusing on pediatric value-based care and health equity. Sheila is actively involved with The Center, volunteering and working out. She and her husband support The Center’s fund-raising activities, wildlife rescue and regularly spend time at the Rod & Reel Pier.
Elizabeth Hager
Elizabeth Hager was in public service for almost three decades:  she was first elected to the New Hampshire Legislature in 1972 and served thirteen terms until 2008. Ms. Hager was a Concord City Councilor for a decade, serving as the city’s mayor from 1988 to 1990. In 1974, as a member of the Constitutional Convention, she sponsored the Equal Rights Amendment which became part of the NH constitution in March of 1975.
Ms. Hager retired in 2011 from Granite United Way. Since 1996 she had served as Executive Director of the United Way of Merrimack County in Concord. Before that she was involved as a volunteer, including roles as both President of the Board and Campaign Chair at United Way.
Ms. Hager is currently the President of the Board of Directors of the AMI Historical Society and a member of the Missions Committee of Roser Church after having served on the Boards of many organizations in NH before she and her husband became winter resident of Holmes Beach. She was a Director of the Lincoln Variable Insurance Products Trust.
Liz is a graduate of Wellesley College and has an MPA degree from UNH. She and her husband, Dennis, have been married for 56 years and have two married daughters and four grandchildren.
Caroline Leibfried
Caroline, a 7th generation Floridian, was born and raised in the heart of Central Florida. She pursued her passion for communication at the University of Florida, earning a degree in Public Relations. It was during her college years that she met her husband, Brian, and after several years of marriage, they embarked on an 11-year adventure in Chicago, where they welcomed their two children. In 2020, the family returned to Florida, settling on the idyllic Anna Maria Island. Deeply rooted in her community, Caroline and her husband are active members, with their children attending Anna Maria Elementary (AME) and participating in various sports at the community center. Caroline further contributes to the school community by serving on the AME PTO board.
Christine Major-Hicks
With an undergraduate degree in marketing and accounting from Indiana University and a MBA from University of Tampa in finance and economics, Christine had a varied and experienced filled career. She worked for GTE/Verizon for 17 years, spent 10 years as a successful licensed mortgage broker and was the business manager for her late husband’s real estate law firm, title company and property management firms. Christine moved to Anna Maria in 2010 and is a licensed real estate sales associate with Atlantic Coast Realty Advisors. Her daughter, Jayne Major Swanson, is a horse trainer in Raleigh NC, her step daughter, Jessie Hicks, is an accountant in Salt Lake City and her son is Captain Sam Major of Captain Major Fishing Charters on Anna Maria. Christine volunteers at The Center, is a care giver for her brother and enjoys traveling. She has a focus on fitness including yoga, pilates, hiking, biking and kayaking.
Kathy Morgan-Johnson
Kathleen Morgan has called Anna Maria Island her home for 18 yrs. Prior to moving here, she lived in New York where she operated a successful tire and auto business for 23 years. Having a vacation home on the island and with the passing of her husband, Kathy moved to Anna Maria along with her children Leah and Troy. When Leah was only 5, she started kindergarten here and attended The Center’s afterschool and vacation programs. Kathy had discovered The Center was a great place for kids, and today participates in exercise, craft, and dance classes.
Kathy has degrees in Computer Science and Graphic Arts. As the owner of Morgan Johnson Realty, she is a Florida real estate Broker and has maintained her real estate license for over 20 years. She also works as a legal assistant in Sarasota for her husband, David P. Johnson, a Board-Certified Wills, Trust & Estates and Tax Attorney. They both believe that The Center is an important part of the community and are committed to its continued success.
Ben Webb
Ben was born and raised on Anna Maria Island. He went to Anna Maria Island Elementary and grew up at The Center of Anna Maria Island during the sixties and seventies. Ben has been married to his wife Susan for over 38 years and has three children, JD, Nicole and Ben, four grandchildren Ehvie, Harper, Archer and Jase.
Ben grew up in business under the watchful eye of his father JD Webb who owned the first drug store on Anna Maria Island. With more than 50 years of business experience, Ben is now the owner of Anna Maria Island Dolphin Tours where he offers exciting boat tours around the waters of Anna Maria Island.
